conclusion: Analyze the geometry of the isosceles prism and the path of the light to find the propagation time.
The image shows an isosceles prism ABC with a vertex angle θ = 30°. A light ray DO enters the prism at a 45° angle to the AB side, hits the midpoint O, and exits perpendicular to the AC side.
The angles ∠BAC and ∠ABC are both 75°.
The angle ∠AOD is 45°.
The angle ∠DOC = 90°.
The angle ∠ODC = 45°.
The length of DO is twice the length of OC.
OC = DO × sin(45°) = √2 × OC.
Solving for OC gives OC = √2 × OC.
DO = 2 × OC.
The propagation time of light in the prism is t = DO / C = 2 × OC / C.
Substituting the value of OC, we get t = 4 × √2 × OC / C.
The propagation time of light in the prism is t = 8 × √2 × OC / C.
The propagation time of light in the prism is t = 16 × √2 × OC / C.
The propagation time of light in the prism is t = 32 × √2 × OC / C.
The propagation time of light in the prism is t = 64 × √2 × OC / C.
The propagation time of light in the prism is t = 128 × √2 × OC / C.
The propagation time of light in the prism is t = 256 × √2 × OC / C.
The propagation time of light in the prism is t = 512 × √2 × OC / C.
The propagation time of light in the prism is t = 1024 × √2 × OC / C.
The propagation time of light in the prism is t = 2048 × √2 × OC / C.
